intro: Conostylis misera, commonly known as the slender conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue or white flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Conostylis misera is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, showcasing resilience through its drought-tolerant nature.
